alert.note: Alert for Lower Clark Fork Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 01 at 11:27AM MST until December 02 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 PM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations 10 to 15 inches from Lookout Pass to Taft, 4 to 8 to Haugan. Lower elevations 2 to 4 inches, with a mix of freezing rain. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Lower Clark Fork Region. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 5 PM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
